## Filtering RSEM table

```{r, eval = FALSE}
ann <- read.delim("ann_table.txt")
head(ann)

# Select only SeqName column
ann <- ann %>% pull(SeqName)
```

```{r, eval = FALSE}
rsem <- read.delim("Transcript_RSEM_count_table.txt")
result <- filter(rsem, Name %in% ann)
write.csv(result, "RSEM_filtered.csv")
```

## Read data
```{r}
countData <- read.csv("FinalRSEM_for_DEapp.csv", header = TRUE, sep = ",")
head(countData)
```

```{r}
metaData <- read.csv('Metadata_DEapp.csv', header = TRUE, sep = ",", stringsAsFactor=TRUE)
metaData
```
```{r}
dds <- DESeqDataSetFromMatrix(countData=countData, 
                              colData=metaData, 
                              design=~Group + Tide, tidy = TRUE)
```

```{r}
dds <- DESeq(dds)
#?DESeq
```

```{r}
res <- results(dds)
head(results(dds, tidy=TRUE))
```

```{r}
summary(res) 
```
```{r}
res <- res[order(res$padj),]
head(res)
write.csv(as.data.frame(res), 
          file="Log2Fold.csv")
```

## Volcano Plot
Reference: https://training.galaxyproject.org/training-material/topics/transcriptomics/tutorials/rna-seq-viz-with-volcanoplot/tutorial.html
```{r}
#reset par
par(mfrow=c(1,1))
# Make a basic volcano plot
with(res, plot(log2FoldChange, -log10(pvalue), pch=20, main="Volcano plot", xlim=c(-3,3)))

# Add colored points: blue if padj<0.01, red if log2FC>1 and padj<0.05)
with(subset(res, padj<.01 ), points(log2FoldChange, -log10(pvalue), pch=20, col="blue"))
with(subset(res, padj<.01 & abs(log2FoldChange)>2), points(log2FoldChange, -log10(pvalue), pch=20, col="red"))

```

## Heatmap

Which transformation method should I use? Options: shifted logarithm transformation, the regularized log transformation and the variance stabilizing transformation
```{r}
ntd <- normTransform(dds)

#install.packages("pheatmap")
library("pheatmap")
select <- order(rowMeans(counts(dds,normalized=TRUE)),
                decreasing=TRUE)[1:20]
df <- as.data.frame(colData(dds)[,c("Group","Tide")])
pheatmap(assay(ntd)[select,], cluster_rows=FALSE, show_rownames=FALSE,
         cluster_cols=FALSE, annotation_col=df)
```
```{r}
vsdata <- vst(dds, blind=FALSE)
sampleDists <- dist(t(assay(vsdata)))
#install.packages("RColorBrewer")
library("RColorBrewer")
sampleDistMatrix <- as.matrix(sampleDists)
rownames(sampleDistMatrix) <- paste(vsdata$Group, vsdata$Tide, sep="-")
colnames(sampleDistMatrix) <- NULL
colors <- colorRampPalette( rev(brewer.pal(9, "Blues")) )(255)
pheatmap(sampleDistMatrix,
         clustering_distance_rows=sampleDists,
         clustering_distance_cols=sampleDists,
         col=colors)
```

```{r}
# Gene clustering
library("genefilter")
topVarGenes <- head(order(rowVars(assay(vsdata)), decreasing = TRUE), 20)
mat  <- assay(vsdata)[ topVarGenes, ]
mat  <- mat - rowMeans(mat)
anno <- as.data.frame(colData(vsdata)[, c("Group","Tide")])
pheatmap(mat, annotation_col = anno)
```

## PCA
```{r}
#First we need to transform the raw count data
#vst function will perform variance stabilizing transformation

plotPCA(vsdata, intgroup="Group")
plotPCA(vsdata, intgroup="Group", "Tide")
```
```{r}
plotPCA(vsdata, intgroup=c("Group", "Tide"))

pcaData <- plotPCA(vsdata, intgroup=c("Group", "Tide"), returnData=TRUE)
percentVar <- round(100 * attr(pcaData, "percentVar"))
ggplot(pcaData, aes(PC1, PC2, color=Group, shape=Tide)) +
  geom_point(size=3) +
  xlab(paste0("PC1: ",percentVar[1],"% variance")) +
  ylab(paste0("PC2: ",percentVar[2],"% variance")) + 
  coord_fixed()
```

```{r}
rld <- rlog(dds)
plotPCA(rld)

# also possible to perform custom transformation:
dds <- estimateSizeFactors(dds)
# shifted log of normalized counts
se <- SummarizedExperiment(log2(counts(dds, normalized=TRUE) + 1),
                           colData=colData(dds))
# the call to DESeqTransform() is needed to
# trigger our plotPCA method.
plotPCA( DESeqTransform( se ) )
```
